definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: More than 68 000 pigs have died of the virus or been culled.
sentences.chinese: 已有68000头猪死于这种病毒或被扑杀。

sentences.english: Sick animals were immediately quarantined and soon culled.
sentences.chinese: 病畜迅速得到检疫并立刻被扑杀。

sentences.english: No cases have been confirmed in poultry workers or cullers.
sentences.chinese: 在家禽饲养工人或扑杀人员中无确认病例。

sentences.english: Did the ancients have exchequers or safes?How did they hide money?
sentences.chinese: 在没有杀虫剂的时代，古人如何扑杀害虫？

sentences.english: The authorities began culling operations in the area over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 当局在周末开始在该地区开展扑杀行动。

sentences.english: Culling and the application of biosecurity measures alone may not stop the spread of the virus.
sentences.chinese: 单凭扑杀和生物安全措施可能无法遏制病毒传播。

definition: to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to attack with a bladed weapon
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to run away/to flee in disarray
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
